meanings.definition: To move quickly and smoothly in a specified direction.
meanings.sent1: The car will zoom down the road.
meanings.sent2: I love to zoom around on my bike.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to zoom up the tree for a better view.
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to zoom with excitement as she approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The rocket zoomed into the sky, leaving a trail of smoke behind.

meanings.definition: To increase rapidly in size or scope.
meanings.sent1: The number of participants will zoom up for the event.
meanings.sent2: The popularity of the game zoomed after the new update.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter seemed to zoom in the oven, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence began to zoom as she received positive feedback.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden seemed to zoom overnight, blooming beautifully.

meanings.definition: A camera shot that changes smoothly from a long shot to a close-up or vice versa.
meanings.sent1: The director called for a zoom to capture the actor's expression.
meanings.sent2: The documentary used a zoom to focus on the intricate details.
meanings.sent3: During the movie, the zoom made the audience giggle at the sudden close-up.
meanings.sent4: The photographer's zoom highlighted the texture of the fabric in the picture.
meanings.sent5: The wildlife documentary used a zoom to reveal the hidden beauty of nature.
